clinical_study.brief_title: SHARE Model Communication Course and Do-not-resuscitate Signing
clinical_study.official_title: The Attendance to SHARE Model Communication Course by Physicians Increases the Signing of Do-not-resuscitate Orders for Critical Patients in the Emergency Room

brief_summary.textblock: This study aimed to investigate the effect of attending a SHARE model communication course by emergency physicians on patient notification and signing of do-not-resuscitate (DNR) orders for critical patients in the emergency room.

detailed_description.textblock: An observation form designed based on the SHARE model was completed by two observers who noted the communication process between physicians and patients and family members during patient notification and signing a DNR order. To assess the influence of physicians attending a SHARE model course on the signing of DNR orders, a propensity score-matched population was created to reduce the potential selection bias of patients and family members.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with DNR singing observation form
primary_outcome.description: The content of the observation form was filled by observers during the explanation process

arm_group.description: Patients who are suggested to family about a do-not-resuscitate order treatment by physicians.

intervention.description: Patients who are considered as terminally ill and would not benefit from aggressive treatment, who physicians suggest to family about a do-not-resuscitate.
The current emergency medical department departments within the preparation of the attending physician

study_pop.textblock: The research subjects consisted of attending physicians, who were willing to inform consent forms, in the emergency department between May 2017 and April 2018.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are considered as terminally ill and would not benefit from aggressive treatment, who physicians suggest to family about a "Do not resuscitate" order.
- Patients who was not register with "Do- not- resuscitate" on their health insurance card.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Trauma patients.
- Suicide patients.
- Patients of age less than 20.
